question: Which national team does Jack Tinkler play for?

content.source_1:
Title: The Kiwi Connection: Jack Tinkler's Journey to the New Zealand National Football Team

In the land of the long white cloud, where the rugged mountains meet the rolling hills, a young boy named Jack Tinkler grew up with a passion for the beautiful game. Born and raised in New Zealand, Jack's love for football was ignited at a tender age, and he spent countless hours honing his skills on the pitch. Little did he know, his dedication and perseverance would one day earn him a coveted spot on the New Zealand national football team. As Jack navigated the junior ranks, his talent and work ethic didn't go unnoticed. He was soon selected to represent his region in various youth tournaments, where he caught the attention of national team scouts. The whispers of his potential began to spread, and Jack's name became synonymous with New Zealand's football future. Fast-forward to 2015, when Jack received the call-up to join the New Zealand national football team for a friendly match against South Korea. It was a moment he had dreamed of since childhood, and he was determined to make the most of it. Jack's debut was nothing short of impressive, as he brought a level of energy and enthusiasm that inspired his teammates. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Jack's involvement with the national team is his appearance in the 2018 FIFA World Cup qualifiers. As New Zealand faced off against Solomon Islands, Jack played a crucial role in the team's 6-1 victory, scoring a goal and providing an assist. This performance not only showcased his skills but also demonstrated his ability to perform under pressure on the biggest stage. Further evidence of Jack's national team credentials can be found in his participation in the 2019 Pacific Games. As New Zealand's U-23 team competed in the tournament, Jack was an integral part of the squad, helping his team secure a bronze medal. This achievement not only highlighted his growth as a player but also underscored his commitment to representing his country. In addition to his on-field accomplishments, Jack's involvement with the national team is also reflected in his interactions with teammates and coaches. In an interview with New Zealand Football, Jack spoke about the sense of camaraderie within the team, stating, "We're like a family, and that's what makes it so special to play for New Zealand." This quote not only reveals Jack's passion for the team but also provides insight into the strong bonds that exist within the national setup.
content.source_2: As the sun dipped into the Gulf of Mexico, casting a warm orange glow over Al Lang Stadium, Jack Tinkler laced up his cleats and took a deep breath. The humid Florida air clung to his skin, a far cry from the crisp winds of his native New Zealand. Yet, as he gazed out at the rowdy crowd of Rowdies fans, he felt a sense of belonging he'd never quite found on the other side of the world. Jack's journey to Tampa Bay had been a winding one. After cutting his teeth in the New Zealand football scene, he'd made the bold decision to leave the comforts of home and test his mettle in the States. It wasn't easy, of course – the language barrier, the cultural adjustments, the grueling training sessions that left him gasping for air. But Jack had always been driven by a fierce determination to succeed. As he took the field alongside his Rowdies teammates, Jack's mind flashed back to the countless hours he'd spent honing his skills on the rugged pitches of Auckland. His parents, both die-hard football fans, had encouraged him from a young age, ferrying him to training sessions and cheering him on from the sidelines. Now, as he prepared to face off against the visiting team, Jack felt their pride and support coursing through his veins like a shot of adrenaline. The whistle blew, and the game was underway. Jack sprinted down the wing, his blond hair streaming behind him as he chased down a loose ball. The Rowdies' fans, a raucous bunch known for their green and gold attire, erupted into cheers as Jack expertly dribbled past a defender and sent a cross into the box. In the stands, a group of Kiwis – expats and fans alike – waved a giant New Zealand flag, their faces beaming with pride. They'd followed Jack's journey from afar, and now, as they watched him take the field for the Rowdies, they felt a sense of validation. This was their boy, the one who'd dared to dream big and make it happen. As the game wore on, Jack's name echoed through the stadium, his every touch and tackle met with applause and adoration.
